titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the account book for construction of buildings on Pineapple Street, Brooklyn 1973.180
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-08T14:34-0500

did.unittitle: Account book for construction of buildings on Pineapple Street, Brooklyn
did.abstract: One account book, kept by an unnamed construction company, relating to the construction of buildings at #60 and #62 Pineapple Street in Brooklyn during the period 1884 to 1886. The book details estimates and transactions in accounts held with various sub-contractors and suppliers. An index of company names is included.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Ruth McGovern, date unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Account book for construction of buildings on Pineapple Street, Brooklyn, 1973.180, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
